EXTRACTED VALUE: Jeff Teague is officially splitting backup PG duties with rookie Jordan Crawford, based upon matchups.
Yao Ming (ankle/leg) will not practice this week.
Jermaine Taylor has moved ahead of Ish Smith in the Rockets' rotation.
Luke Harangody had 16 points, 12 rebounds and hit two 3-pointers on 4-of-9 shooting in Wednesday's win over the Knicks.
Golden State rookie guard Jeremy Lin finished Sunday's blowout loss with a career-high 13 points in 18 minutes.
The Spurs have signed veteran point guard Chris Quinn.
Blazers assigned first-round F Luke Babbitt to the Idaho Stampede of the NBADL.
Blake Griffin had 21 points and 15 rebounds vs. the Blazers on Sunday, but he was just 7-of-16 from the FT line.
Quinton Ross returned to action from a calf injury on Friday but played just 28 seconds.
Coach Avery Johnson confirmed that Joe Smith will start at power forward in Wednesday's season opener.
Coach John Kuester said he would like to use Tayshaun Prince at power forward a lot.
Timofey Mozgov had five points, six boards and three blocks in Saturday's loss to the Hawks.
Chris Wilcox made his season debut for the Pistons on Wednesday and had four points in three minutes.
The MRI taken on Chris Kaman's injured left ankle showed a bone bruise, and he will not play in Wednesday's game and possibly more.
Carlos Delfino (concussion symptoms) admitted that he is still experiencing headaches.
Daequan Cook hit three 3-pointers to score 13 points on 5-of-9 shooting Wednesday.
The Wizards are unlikely to sign second-round pick Hamady Ndiaye for the upcoming season.
A.J. Price made his season-debut on Tuesday, scoring seven points on 2-of-3 shooting with no rebounds and two assists in 11 minutes.
Mario Chalmers scored nine points on 4-of-10 shooting (including a three) with five rebounds, four assists, and a steal on Saturday.
Sam Young admitted he is baffled by his role in the Grizzlies' rotation so far this season.
Wizards rookie Kevin Seraphin recently received his work visa and arrived in Washington on Saturday.
Charlie Bell has been traded to the Warriors, along with Dan Gadzuric, in exchange for Corey Maggette.
Nuggets forward Renaldo Balkman hasn't been giving it his all at practice, according to beat writer Benjamin Hochman.
Luke Walton returned to action on Friday November 5.
Nets center Johan Petro is averaging a mere 0.8 points and 2.2 rebounds this season.
Leon Powe scored 10 points on 5-of-9 shooting with six rebounds, no assists, and no steals or blocks in a start at small forward on Saturday.
Rookie Dominique Jones was sent to the Texas Legends of the D-League on Monday.
Steve Novak was signed by DAL on Wednesday November 10.
DeSagana Diop had four points, four rebounds, a block and a steal in 20 minutes Wednesday and coach Larry Brown liked what he saw.
Marcus Banks will not be joining the Hornets under the advice of his representatives.
Aaron Brooks (ankle) admitted that he still hasn't been cleared to practice.
Marcus Thornton played 10 minutes on Wednesday and scored seven points after not getting off the bench on Monday.
The Suns are not expected to pick up Earl Clark's extension.
Roy Hibbert had 15 points, five rebounds and zero blocks on 5-of-9 shooting in Wednesday's loss to the Jazz.
Jeremy Evans had five points in six minutes in his return from a wrist injury.
Jared Jeffries had 12 points and eight rebounds on 6-of-9 shooting in Wednesday's exhibition game in China.
Melvin Ely scored a season-high nine points on 4-of-14 shooting with six rebounds and one assist in 17 minutes off the bench.
Timberwolves center Kosta Koufos may sit out Friday's game with a touch of food poisoning.
Jason Kapono returned to 76ers practice on Monday after spending some time away for personal reasons.
B.J. Mullens, the No. 24 overall draft pick in 2009, will get the start at center for Tuesday's preseason game against the Grizzlies.
Mavs officially announced the signings of Dee Brown, Brian Cardinal and Adam Haluska on Monday.
Sasha Vujacic made his Lakers debut on Sunday and had three points in eight minutes.

Luke Ridnour scored 16 points on 6-of-9 shooting (including three treys) with no rebounds, four assists, and a steal on Monday.
Eduardo Najera (groin) returned to action from a groin injury when he played for one second on Saturday night.
Damion James got 19 minutes of run off the bench in Tuesday's game, scoring 10 points on 5-of-9 shooting with six rebounds, one assist, and one steal.
Coach Gregg Popovich said that he does not yet fully trust Tiago Splitter with the finer details of the offense.
The Raptors assigned rookie center Solomon Alabi to the D-League.
Theo Ratliff suffered a setback after working out his surgically repaired knee, and his timetable for return is unknown at this time as a result.
Darren Collison was able to walk off the ankle/leg injury he suffered late in Monday's win over the Raptors, according to Indycornrows.com.
Malik Allen has made the Magic's roster and will be the team's third center.
Pistons rookies DaJuan Summers and Austin Daye each shot 1-of-7 off the bench in Tuesday's loss to the Bobcats.
Peja Stojakovic is not traveling with the Raptors due to his knee injury and will miss his fourth straight game on Monday.

Gerald Henderson (knee) hopes to resume on-court activity in a week.
Robin Lopez (knee) could return to full team practices as soon as next week.

Craig Smith scored eight points on 3-of-5 shooting with four rebounds, no assists, and two steals in 22 minutes on Tuesday.

Joel Anthony started and logged 24 minutes on Sunday, collecting one point, three rebounds, four blocks and a steal.

Hassan Whiteside was sent to the D-league on Monday.

Willie Warren could build off his career-high 17 minutes played on Friday, if Eric Bledsoe (ankle) and Randy Foye (hamstring) cannot play on Sunday.

Cavaliers rookie Samardo Samuels missed the end of Tuesday's practice because of cramping. He was given fluids and will be fine.

Matt Carroll, who enjoyed his best season in Charlotte in 2006-07, when he averaged 12 ppg, has been traded back to Charlotte by the Mavericks.
Jason Collins started at center on Tuesday against Brook Lopez and the Nets, with Marvin Williams getting the start at shooting guard.
Lakers rookie Devin Ebanks sat out Sunday's game because of intestinal flu.
David Lee scored 20 points on 9-of-22 shooting with eight rebounds, seven assists, and one steal on Tuesday.
The Thunder recalled rookie Cole Aldrich from the D-League on Monday.

Swingman Julian Wright was traded from the Hornets to the Raptors on Wednesday.
Jose Calderon is averaging 11.9 points, 8.0 assists, 1.6 steals and 1.3 3-pointers in the eight games since Jarrett Jack has been traded.
Jermaine O'Neal is back with the Celtics and working out, but could still be two weeks away from returning.
Byron Scott is reportedly thinking about changing the starting lineup for the Cavaliers, but gave no hints as to what he might do.

Andy Rautins (knee bruise) is expected to be ready for training camp.
